chapter.title: Relatório: Detalhes do Pedido
chapter.para: Descrição: Relatório de Detalhes de Pedidos
Comentário/Ajuda: O relatório emite informações detalhadas do pedido incluindo vendas perdidas. O relatório pode ser utilizado para Vendas e Compras.

row.entry: Esta é uma Transação de Vendas
A caixa de verificação "Transação de Vendas" indica se este item é uma Transação de Vendas.
Identifica um item que é ou comprado ou vendido por esta organização.
Um "Parceiro de Negócios" é qualquer um com quem você transaciona. Isto pode incluir Fornecedores, Clientes, Funcionários, Vendedores, Representantes de Venda, etc.
Representante de Vendas ou Promotor de Vendas da Companhia
O campo "Representante de Vendas" indica o representante de vendas para esta região. Qualquer Representante de Vendas tem que ser um usuário interno válido.
Uma "Organização" é uma unidade de sua "Empresa" ou "Entidade Legal" - os exemplos são loja, departamento. Você pode compartilhar dados entre organizações.
Identifica a categoria à qual este produto pertence. Categorias de Produto são usadas para formação de preços e seleção.
"Atividade" indica tarefas que são executadas e utilizadas para Cálculo de Custo Baseado em Atividade
A "Região de Vendas" indica uma área específica de cobertura de vendas.
Disponibilidade Forçar Linha Completa Manual Pedido Completo Após o recebimento

A "Regra de Entrega" indica quando um pedido deve ser entregue. Por exemplo: define se o pedido deve ser entregue quando o pedido inteiro estiver completo, quando uma linha estiver completa ou assim que os produtos estiverem disponíveis.
Indica se este documento exige aprovação
A caixa de verificação "Aprovado" indica se este documento exige aprovação antes que possa ser processado.
Ativo Tipo de Despesa Item Online Recurso Serviços
O Tipo de Produto também determina as conseqüências contábeis.
Desconhecido Aprovado Fechado Completado Esboçado Inválido Em Progresso Não Aprovado Estornado Anulado Aguardando Confirmação Esperando pagamento
O "Estado do Documento" indica o estado de um documento neste momento. Se você deseja alterar o Estado do Documento, use o campo "Ação do Documento"
Após Entrega Imediato Após pedido despachado Programação do Cliente após entrega
A "Regra de Fatura" define o modo e a freqüência de emissão de faturamento a um Parceiro de Negócios.
O "Tipo de Documento" determina a seqüência do documento e as regras de processamento
Coluna de relação com a tabela de tipo de produto
Coluna de relação com a tabela de classe de produto
Coluna de relação com a tabela de grupo do produto
Indica se Documentos deste TdD são ou não exibidos em relatórios do sistema.

Usado por exemplo para excluir documentos que não compõem receitas de vendas (venda de ativo imobilizado, remessas, etc) ou outras situações. Consultar documentações para saber os relatórios que interpretam ou não esta opção.
Indica a Data que um item foi pedido.
Data que o Pedido foi prometido
A "Data Prometida" indica a data, se existir, que um Pedido foi prometido.
User within the system - Internal or Business Partner Contact
The User identifies a unique user in the system. This could be an internal user or a business partner contact
Amount of lost sales in Invoice Currency
If empty the shipment business partner will be invoiced
Activities indicate tasks that are performed and used to utilize Activity based Costing
A Business Partner is anyone with whom you transact. This can include Vendor, Customer, Employee or Salesperson
Identifies the (ship to) address for this Business Partner
The Partner address indicates the location of a Business Partner
The Campaign defines a unique marketing program. Projects can be associated with a pre defined Marketing Campaign. You can then report based on a specific Campaign.
The Cash Journal Line indicates a unique line in a cash journal.
The Currency Conversion Rate Type lets you define different type of rates, e.g. Spot, Corporate and/or Sell/Buy rates.
Indicates the Currency to be used when processing or reporting on this record
The Document Type determines document sequence and processing rules
Target document type for conversing documents
You can convert document types (e.g. from Offer to Order or Invoice). The conversion is then reflected in the current type. This processing is initiated by selecting the appropriate Document Action.
The Charge Amount indicates the amount for an additional charge.
Indica se Documentos deste TdD são ou não exibidos em relatórios do sistema.

Usado por exemplo para excluir documentos que não compõem receitas de vendas (venda de ativo imobilizado, remessas, etc) ou outras situações. Consultar documentações para saber os relatórios que interpretam ou não esta opção.
Produto Bloqueado Produto Descontinuado Produto Especial Produto Linha Produto Promocional Produto Ponta de Estoque Produto Sazonal
Parceiro Ativo Parceiro Bloqueado Comercial Parceiro Bloqueado Crédito Parceiro Encerrado Parceiro Inativo-Concorrente Parceiro Pendente de Análise Parceiro em Recuperação

The Order is a control document. The Order is complete when the quantity ordered is the same as the quantity shipped and invoiced. When you close an order, unshipped (backordered) quantities are cancelled.
The Sales Order Line is a unique identifier for a line in an order.
The Payment is a unique identifier of this payment.
Payment Terms identify the method and timing of payment.
The POS Terminal defines the defaults and functions available for the POS Form
A Project allows you to track and control internal or external activities.
Actual Project Task in a Phase
A Project Task in a Project Phase represents the actual work.
The Created field indicates the date that this record was created.
The Created By field indicates the user who created this record.
The Sales Region indicates a specific area of sales coverage.
The Tax indicates the type of tax used in document line.
The UOM defines a unique non monetary Unit of Measure
The Accounting Date indicates the date to be used on the General Ledger account entries generated from this document. It is also used for any currency conversion.
Date when the product was delivered
The Date Invoice indicates the date printed on the invoice.
Indicates the Date an item was ordered.
Indicates the Date that a document was printed.
The Date Promised indicates the date, if any, that an Order was promised for.

The Delivery Rule indicates when an order should be delivered. For example should the order be delivered when the entire order is complete, when a line is complete or as the products become available.
How the order will be delivered
The Delivery Via indicates how the products should be delivered. For example, will the order be picked up or shipped.
The Discount indicates the discount applied or taken as a percentage.

< Nenhum>
Aprovar Fechar Completo Invalidar Lançar Preparar Estornar - Provisão Estornar - Corrigir Reativar Rejeitar Anulado Espere Completar Destravar (CO)
The targeted status of the document
You find the current status in the Document Status field. The options are listed in a popup
Desconhecido Aprovado Fechado Completado Esboçado Inválido Em Progresso Não Aprovado Estornado Anulado Aguardando Confirmação Esperando pagamento (DR)
The current status of the document
The Document Status indicates the status of a document at this time. If you want to change the document status, use the Document Action field
Document sequence number of the document

The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "< > ".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_< TableName> ", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
If empty the business partner will be shipped to.
Business Partner Location for shipping to
Business Partner Contact for drop shipment
The Freight Cost Rule indicates the method used when charging for freight.
The Grand Total displays the total amount including Tax and Freight in document currency
Date when the normal guarantee or availability expires
The Invoice Rule defines how a Business Partner is invoiced and the frequency of invoicing.
Indicates if this document requires approval
The Approved checkbox indicates if this document requires approval before it can be processed.
Credit Approved indicates if the credit approval was successful for Orders
if true, the line is just description and no transaction

If a line is Description Only, e.g. Product Inventory is not corrected. No accounting transactions are created and the amount or totals are not included in the document. This for including descriptive detail lines, e.g. for an Work Order.
Print Discount on Invoice and Order
The Discount Printed Checkbox indicates if the discount will be printed on the document.
Drop Shipments are sent from the Vendor directly to the Customer
Drop Shipments do not cause any Inventory reservations or movements as the Shipment is from the Vendor's inventory. The Shipment of the Vendor to the Customer must be confirmed.
Is the Payment Schedule is valid
Payment Schedules allow to have multiple due dates.
Indicates if this document / line is printed
The Printed checkbox indicates if this document or line will included when printing.
This is a Self-Service entry or this entry can be changed via Self-Service

Self-Service allows users to enter data or update their data. The flag indicates, that this record was entered or created via Self-Service or that the user can change it via the Self-Service functionality.
The Sales Transaction checkbox indicates if this item is a Sales Transaction.
Tax is included in the price
The Tax Included checkbox indicates if the prices include tax. This is also known as the gross price.
The transferred checkbox indicates if the transactions associated with this document should be transferred to the General Ledger.
Indicates the unique line for a document. It will also control the display order of the lines within a document.
Line Extended Amount (Quantity * Actual Price) without Freight and Charges

Indicates the extended line amount based on the quantity and the actual price. Any additional charges or freight are not included. The Amount may or may not include tax. If the price list is inclusive tax, the line amount is the same as the line total.
This field links a sales order to the purchase order that is generated from it.
This field links a sales order line to the purchase order line that is generated from it.
The Lot Number indicates the specific lot that a product was part of.
Margin for a product as a percentage
The Margin indicates the margin for this product as a percentage of the limit price and selling price.
Difference between actual and limit price multiplied by the quantity
The margin amount is calculated as the difference between actual and limit price multiplied by the quantity
Define Product Attribute Sets to add additional attributes and values to the product. You need to define a Attribute Set if you want to enable Serial and Lot Number tracking.
The values of the actual Product Attribute Instances. The product level attributes are defined on Product level.
Freight Categories are used to calculate the Freight for the Shipper selected
The individual Lot of a Product
Unique identifier of a Price List
Price Lists are used to determine the pricing, margin and cost of items purchased or sold.
Identifies the category which this product belongs to. Product categories are used for pricing and selection.
Identifies an item which is either purchased or sold in this organization.
The Warehouse identifies a unique Warehouse where products are stored or Services are provided.
Indicates the net amount for this invoice. It does not include shipping or any additional charges.
Type of Order: MRP records grouped by source (Sales Order, Purchase Order, Distribution Order, Requisition)
Business Partner responsible for the payment
Location of the Business Partner responsible for the payment
The Payment Rule indicates the method of invoice payment.
Transaction Reference Number (Sales Order, Purchase Order) of your Business Partner

The business partner order reference is the order reference for this specific transaction; Often Purchase Order numbers are given to print on Invoices for easier reference. A standard number can be defined in the Business Partner (Customer) window.
The Posted field indicates the status of the Generation of General Ledger Accounting Lines
The Actual or Unit Price indicates the Price for a product in source currency.
Price per Unit of Measure including all indirect costs (Freight, etc.)
Optional Purchase Order Line cost price.
Price Entered - the price based on the selected/base UoM
The price entered is converted to the actual price based on the UoM conversion
The Price Limit indicates the lowest price for a product stated in the Price List Currency.
The List Price is the official List Price in the document currency.
The Priority indicates the importance (high, medium, low) of this document
The date+time (expressed in decimal format) when the document has been processed
The ProcessedOn Date+Time save the exact moment (nanoseconds precision if allowed by the DB) when a document has been processed.
The type of product also determines accounting consequences.
User entered promotion code at sales time
If present, user entered the promotion code at sales time to get this promotion
The Delivered Quantity indicates the quantity of a product that has been delivered.
The Quantity Entered is based on the selected UoM
The Quantity Entered is converted to base product UoM quantity
The Invoiced Quantity indicates the quantity of a product that have been invoiced.

When an order is closed and there is a difference between the ordered quantity and the delivered (invoiced) quantity is the Lost Sales Quantity. Note that the Lost Sales Quantity is 0 if you void an order, so close the order if you want to track lost opportunities. [Void = data entry error - Close = the order is finished]
The Ordered Quantity indicates the quantity of a product that was ordered.
The Reserved Quantity indicates the quantity of a product that is currently reserved.
Reference of the Sales Order Line to the corresponding Purchase Order Line or vice versa.
Reference of the Sales Order Line to the corresponding Purchase Order Line or vice versa.

The amount for revenue recognition calculation. If empty, the complete invoice amount is used. The difference between Revenue Recognition Amount and Invoice Line Net Amount is immediately recognized as revenue.
The date the revenue recognition starts.
The Sales Representative indicates the Sales Rep for this Region. Any Sales Rep must be a valid internal user.
Send emails with document attached (e.g. Invoice, Delivery Note, etc.)
The Serial Number identifies a tracked, warranted product. It can only be used when the quantity is 1.
The Total amount displays the total of all lines in document currency
The Updated field indicates the date that this record was updated.
The Updated By field indicates the user who updated this record.
The Volume indicates the volume of the product in the Volume UOM of the Client
The Weight indicates the weight of the product in the Weight UOM of the Client
